text: "Julia Child once saw a boy crying because he couldn't make a great omelette. She told him to follow his dreams and to help others cook delicious things. That boy was called <@U687RKK0E> one of the founders of the Julia Language, who named it in her honor, and now many can make cook up delicious algorithms as well. But the evil BigJuliaMarketingDivision doesn't want you to know its true historical origin! Share to your top 10 closest friends so that your CI never fails"

text: Someone mentioned the other day that we can just as well create a false origin and use that as an easier reply that what we currently have. Basically just lie as a group and say "It's named after Julia sets". I don't like the idea but thought it funny to just rewrite history for our convenience

text: Hahaha, we add a <http://www.scpwiki.com/|SCP> called Julia, which is a abstract entity which nobody can remember how it came to be called like that.

elements.text: SCP?

text: I did take a quick look, but I don’t know what that is.

elements.text: I did take a quick look, but I don’t know what that is.

text: SCP's are object with supernatural abilities. The SCP foundations is a foundation which mission is secure, contain and protect these objects. The SCP wiki is a library with information of both (fantastical) the foundations and the objects.

elements.text: SCP's are object with supernatural abilities. The SCP foundations is a foundation which mission is secure, contain and protect these objects. The SCP wiki is a library with information of both (fantastical) the foundations and the objects.

text:
There is an (supposed) object that cannot be remember, so if someone see it, that person immediately forgets it.

I said that it could be funny to add a SCP called Julia, which is an abstract entity and is supernatural ability is that it is impossible to know how it came to be called like that (but it is known there is a reason for its name), and to curse the humanity into trying to find the reason behind its name.
